Issue.summary: Inconsistent data type for block numbers
Issue.description: Apparently owing to a hangover from Tendermint integration, parts of the Seth and Burrow codebases use a signed int64 type for block numbers, and other parts use the (correct, IMV) unsigned type. Â Apart from being a bit unsightly this causes issues with interfaces, will ultimately break the network (in about 30 years), and makes the code generally fragile to maintain.
